sentences.sContent: The age of the candidates ranged from 29 to 49 with an average age of 37.
sentences.sCn: 候选人的年龄29岁至49岁不等，平均37岁。

sentences.sContent: The average cost of making a movie has risen by 15%.
sentences.sCn: 制作一部影片的平均成本上升了15%。

sentences.sContent: Last winter was colder than average.
The cars were being sold at an average price of $11,000.
sentences.sCn: 这些汽车的平均售价是1.1万美元。

...I definitely feel things more strongly than the average person...

...Books--especially books the average person could afford--haven't been around long enough to produce evolutionary change in humans...
...There are now large strips of the country where daycare for an infant costs more than a tenth of the average married couple's income...

...the average nevertiree often has no one forcing his hand...
...small schools-most of them with about 400 kids each with an average enrollment of only 150 per grade...
...We’re a nation that’s sweet on sugar: the average US adult downs 22 teaspoons of sugar a day...

...knowledge and history with every average person in our society...
...It’s the average American middle-class family who’s being priced out of the market...
...you will die on average five years before a woman...

synos.tran: 平均；[数]平均数；[保险]海损

phrases.pCn: 在一般水平(或平均数)以上
在一般水平(或平均数)以下
平均以上；在一般水准以上

trans.tranOther: the average amount is the amount you get when you add together several quantities and divide this by the total number of quantities
